p: Herbarium collections are increasingly being recognized as a unique, verifiable, and underused resource of big data across time and space for a variety of research questions (Lavoie, 2012; Funk, 2014; RÃ¸nsted et al., 2017; Cardoso et al., 2018; James et al., 2018). Herbarium collections offer an easily accessible source of specimens for a plethora of research questions compared to field expeditions (Bebber et al., 2010; Hardion et al., 2014; Xu et al., 2015). Additionally, herbarium specimens are records in time and space and represent several 100 years of collection history across the globe, including species rare and extinct or from now gone habitats (Silva et al., 2017) that provide possibilities simply not available using only modern samples.
